question.body: What is a major difference between the production of thyroid hormones and other endocrine hormones?

multiple_choice.choice: They have a very short half-life.
They are stored in large amounts.
They are released into the blood.
They are part of a negative feedback loop.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Many different hormones have different half-lives.
Correct. The thyroid gland stores large amounts of hormones, while many glands synthesize hormones when stimulated and do not store them.
Incorrect. All endocrine glands secrete their hormones into the blood.
Incorrect. Many hormones are involved in negative feedback loops.
